intro: Thesium adpressifolium, commonly known as the dwarf thesium, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to survive in arid conditions. Thesium adpressifolium is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to dry, sunny environments.
